page.title: 11St.Pauls Cray-attitudes.
page.content: People interviewed in the St.Pauls Cray area of Orpington held strong views on the following public amenities. SHOPS.They would like to see an improved shopping area with a greater variety of merchandise of better quality.This could take the form of a shopping precinct from which cars are banned.At the moment,cars are parked anywhere which is dangerous for children and old people. GRAFFITI.There should be a campaign against graffiti,because at the moment graffiti ruins the appearance of many local buildings.Heavy fines were suggest as a deterent. LEISURE.Many people felt that there was need for a leisure complex to increase the sports facilities in the area.The nearest cinema at Sidcup was thought to be too far away and youth club facilities insufficient.
